name: manetheren
text: A comment left by manetheren was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by geesycreesy, sharksarecoming, gkiyo)

name: mortshire
text: Alt text:  A thrifty bachelor uses every part of his offensiveness.

name: spinynorman
text:
I eat stuff off of farts all the damn time. People are always like, "Hey man, you got any plates over here?" and I'm like, "Don't plan on finding no plates up in here unless I'm torchin a wicked case of sass gut"

No ma'am, I do not throw dinner parties, yes sir, my life does have a big CONDEMNED sign hangin on the front

name: soticoto
text:
I discovered that if I don't clean the melted cheese off the microwave plate for a week or so*... and make sure it is evenly spread... it can be cooled to total hardness, carefully peeled off with a spatula and used as a plate for a while.

Just don't get that thing too hot.


* = I get Cornish Pasties from Sainsbury's and then put Tabasco Sauce and Cheddar on them. Total WIN food.

name: odei
text: The man does science!

name: bixschmix
text: I literally got a little queasy just now, picturing that. (However, I am a lady.)

name: lexsenthur
text:
That isn't your gender recoiling in horror, that's your human decency.

Offensiveness stopped being a contest in seventh grade, everybody.

name: rearadmiral
text: So most people think, but those who know sometimes turn pro.

name: griffypoo
text: Queasy?  This guy's like the Martha Stewart of laziness!  It's a good thing!

name: soticoto
text: Did you know that if you microwave a pizza on a plate with a piece of kitchen-towel inbetween, the heated water absorbed from the pizza can then be used to clean the plate after use, eliminating the need for sink use.

name: terriblerobot
text: This man speaks truth, I did this many times during college.

name: drake
text: I normally disagree with your comments, but damn that sounds delicious .

name: carlyle
text: Have you ever been so distracted you just started eating the plate without realizing it

name: soticoto
text: When the cheese gets THAT hard nobody could eat it. Even the mold won't grow on it once I'm done with it.

name: tangram
text: That "No Ma'am, No Sir" turnaround just reminded me of Mr. Horse for some odd reason... "No Sir, I don't like it!"

name: picnick
text: I like it VERY MUCH!

name: undyingsong
text: MST3K reference?

name: greenkoolayd
text: try ren and stimpy, kemo.

name: saint
text: How do you always manage to crack me up? Every time .

name: smallberries
text: My mental voice for spinynorman's comments is Stephen Fry's Jeeves in a very aristocratic and learned British vernacular. This particular comment of his amused me for it cannot be read thus, unless Jeeves hails from 'Bama.

name: carbonation
text: I believe this is the justification for Cup Ramen.

name: rabbitnu
text: A comment left by rabbitnu was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by howmanywhales, stormypinkness, Solle, equinn2006, Sargasm, ethelthefrog, Jeef)

name: zefiel
text:
what room will there be when a truly wonderful moment happens?

Then, science will let us give us fives. That or a Mr. Roast Beef K. will deliver pizzas to the Assetbar building, then hacking the hell outta this dumb website.

name: rodneystubbs
text:
fear not nu-bunny

the perfect 5 seems to be in reserve for Philippe stopping nuclear war with the Eastern Hemisphere with 5-year old Rambo action

name: rizzle
text: Dang I was kinda stoked to see things going so well.. And they're already fighting??

name: jamers
text: Fights are inevitable when planning weddings.

name: mashuren
text: A comment left by mashuren was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, ButterMoths, blastradius, kylank, odei, Julia, logic, Dwilow)

name: crinklebat
text: As a woman, if my boyfriend and I get married, I hope he plans the wedding. Man I cannot think of a more annoying thing to have to do.

name: aaron_haynes
text: "Can we just have a small wedding" is one of the most beautiful things a woman can say to a man.

name: apatfan
text: A comment left by apatfan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, entropyends, mat4900)

name: lastlarf
text: Apparently this has already happened for Beef, with mediocre results. http://achewood.com/index.php?date=10212004

name: quantumcasaba
text:
How about "Let's just elope, and then come back to throw a party for everyone."
Everybody wins!
(I am going to be excommunicated from my family. Ohh shiit.)

name: charchar
text: If it makes you feel better, these were pretty much my exact future plans. Mainly i just want to wear striped tights with sneakers and get drunk when i marry but my mom is not okay with this.  We compromise.

name: thunderbat
text: Ditto.

name: soticoto
text:
Fvck "weddings".

I got married in a Rabbi's livingroom. It took about 10 minutes. No planning involved.

I got divorced with the Atlantic Ocean inbetween AT THE TIME.
Also, we lived that way.

I am proud of my weird ex-marriage.

name: undyingsong
text: Ditto. Weddings are scary.

name: straw
text: And considering she was 12 like 200 years ago that's a lot of planning

name: dougthehead
text: Yeah, I always found it funny that Molly, being from the 1800s, was able to adjust to the 21st century better than Beef has ever lived in it.

name: havenless
text: Damn Molly, way to make an entire gender feel bad.

name: madnes
text: A comment left by madnes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by entropyends, daidai, lateadopter)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ..you would.

name: someone3
text:
tell the truth though, would you eat a fried egg off a fart skin?

i sure as hell would, think of the stories man, think of washing the dishes!!!

name: havenless
text: Oh no question, i mean the time saved alone makes it worthwhile. She just didn't need to say it is all.

name: undyingsong
text: Yeah, she was way too harsh.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Damn. Round One goes to Molly.

name: umbra
text: A comment left by umbra was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, atom, Nasir, Audhumla)

name: shmuckeles
text: TOTALLY pwned

name: hcaz
text:
The Beef got fucking wasted there. But he will recover.

You don't plan the ultimate victory for the Great Outdoor Fight to just roll over and bleed to death because some chick from heaven owned your ass with words.

HATERS ARE TRIPPING.

name: supernintendochalmers
text: GEEZ.....MOLLY

name: dirkd23
text: A comment left by dirkd23 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, entropyends, katal, chivalress, mortshire, bug, Julia, _cheesekayke, lucidaconsole, Sargasm, mira, BlueLoggy, newwavepony, Magb, Oak, NigelChaos, valrus)

name: geigerdog
text: I just love how we're starting to see Molly's speech infected by Beef's odd turns of phrase. Her comeback in the last panel really does read like a hybrid of the two characters styles of dialogue. Bravo!

name: tellumo
text: Molly brings MAXIMUM SASS to the occasion, and Beef completely set himself up for it. Hell, I'm not married, engaged, or even dating anyone, and I know that a) you DO NOT cross the lady on the matter of dinner tableware and b) dinner parties are fun, 'cos you get to show off all the nifty stuff you know how to cook. Beef's moussaka served on proper plates and with the good silver? It is impossible to come back after that; you just go with the flow.

name: waldo913
text:
But can you imagine Beef's moussaka served on a freshly congealed linoleum fart?

Five stars, baby.

name: soticoto
text: Beef was prepared for the Great Outdoor Fight, but not so much the Great Indoor Fight.

name: rogergs
text: Beef gets all punk rock in panel 5.

name: muffmacguff
text: Molly has been working very hard on being gender socialized. She is doing a good job. What about her prospective children?

name: primal_in_the_mane
text: Who can put Sass right back in it's own place? [Molly can]

name: ethelthefrog
text: Hell yes.  Molly brings the Sass like it needs to be brought in the last panel.  And she's right, too.

name: mr_pete
text:
Reverend Mother Helen Gaius Moiham: Many men have tried to create new traditions around the registry.

Paul Atreides: They tried and failed, all of them?

name: captxtreme
text: They tried and died.

name: fresco
text: As one Dune nerd to another: thank you.

name: twotonturkey
text: mr_pete, you get a nerd chubby.  good show, old man.

name: tellumo
text: This is one of the few comments on Acheworld that has actually made me laugh out loud. May the chubbies flowing to you be like unto a mighty torrent.

name: soticoto
text:
Less talk about chubby-flow here my good man.
I just spread out this delightful fart-platter and I'm now starting to lose my appetite.

name: mcwee
text: I can't believe I'm worried that two imaginary cats might break off their engagement.  Onstad, you are the devil.

name: ronm
text:
Both Molly and Beef make valid points.

Molly's is valider.

name: someone3
text: while reading this though i thought molly would agree with beef about dinner parties.

name: solobuttons
text:
So we've all been pumped up about the proposal, and now we have to agonize over the actual Big Day. Guess we didn't think about that until this little ducat$ saga.

Damn your compelling anthropomorphic cats, Onstad! And damn the weekend!

name: tetsujin
text:
I'd just like to take this opportunity to mention that I'm registered at Williams-Sonoma... We've already got more bowls and pots than we know what to do with, a coffee maker that makes more coffee than we'll ever drink in a day, and a number of cool but bulky appliances for our -abundant- kitchen space...

Beef may have a point. :)

name: dartigen
text:
eBay. eBay that.
(I plan to make my relatives register at some swanky place, in order to eBay it all and buy videogames instead. What can I say, my guy is a nerd and unlikely to ever change.)

name: byronic
text:
Beef is correct - it is all a scam by the matromony-industrial complex. Molly is correct that the male of the species is a pig.

Beef should just shut up while he is still has his head.

name: mclarenbabe
text: oh man, molly is my hero!

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: A comment left by jujubeesforjesus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, silver_lake, equinn2006, Mastronaut)

name: tetsujin
text: I don't know what you're talking about.  The "model who doesn't eat holding a fat basted golden goose on truffled raita pilaf" is a common metaphor around the water cooler here, as are the ten fake cooks who supposedly made it...

name: apatfan
text: When have Beef's ramblings every been something that "flows off the tongue"?

name: zefiel
text: Wait wait wait. Are you saying that today's Achewood... sounds too much like Achewood ?

name: philipmarschall
text: THAT IS NEVER A PROBLEM

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Nay.  Rather that there is a definite Achewood style, and sometimes that style just gets used as empty rhetorical flourish instead of being genuinely clever.  This is one of those times.

name: geesycreesy
text: A comment left by geesycreesy was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, silver_lake, phthoggos, Mastronaut)

name: iloveyoucupcake
text: I wonder if Onstad and his wife had this exact argument.

name: lawdog
text: The true beauty here being that they are both completely correct.

name: julia
text: it speaks to the heart of the matter:  being from Circumstances, Beef is unsettled by the prospect of Nice Things.

name: lastlarf
text: The Great Indoor Fight Round One goes to Molly Saunders...

name: cgeiger
text:
Even after reading all the previous comments, my feelings are unchanged.

Perhaps it's Molly's proverbial balls dropping, perhaps it's the visual she invokes, perhaps it's the validity of both cats' points, but...

This is the most beautiful Achewood strip ever. This interaction perfectly illustrates why Molly is the only female who could ever stand Roast Beef, and why she is the only one who could, from time to time, when necessary, get him to shut the hell up about trivial issues. It's love, perhaps the finest Onstad has ever written it.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go set the table. We're having a Greasy Queen over tonight.

...Also, somebody should make a dish or a drink or something called the Greasy Queen, because it's a great name.

name: tellumo
text: For some reason, the notion of a dish called the "Greasy Queen" reminds me of one of my hometown's contributions to the national cuisine, the Juicy Lucy . This Minneapolitan dish is something of an everted cheeseburger: a ground beef patty with a core of cheese, served on a bun. The experienced or well-informed diner will eat the side dishes for a while before tucking into the Lucy proper, as the heat capacity, adhesion, and low viscosity of hot cheese makes biting into one fresh off the grill somewhat dangerous.

name: jar
text: You can tell Molly's been around for a couple of hundred years when she lays out profound bits of wisdom such as this.

name: letterswewrote
text: "in case a greasy queen comes over..."

name: epicurus
text: This strip caused me to learn what an antimacassar was. I am strongly with Beef on this one. All that bone china and those doilies and end table with such as a doilie and a vase and a photo on it - so that the table can't be used for anything but decoration - are the root of evil.

name: rogergs
text: If macassar and antimacassar ever met, the resulting explosion would destroy the visiting parlour.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, Ananke, mortshire, Julia, lucidaconsole, thedudeabides85)

name: mikeleffel2
text: I so hope Beef Jr. both inherits tableware AND produces that reusable fartskin for eggs!!!! (and also is not stillborn.)

name: zapatos
text: and not a harlequin.

name: dsh265
text: A comment left by dsh265 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TBTabby, alphagator, petro, Mastronaut, tragicone)

name: k_buttsworthe
text: i just used a piece of toast as a coaster

name: dapooka
text: Coast---er?  What is this coaster thing you speak of?

name: cherubrocker22
text: I don't think Molly really believes this - rather, she knows Beef so well that she knows exactly what to say to make him get it (or what to say to make him shut up and get on board).

name: tragicone
text: Man, I think Molly was a bit harsh when all Beef was doing was throwing down some high-grade truth.

name: geysershitdick
text: the queen is greasy so you need an antimacassar to prevent her from soiling the chair

name: biznart
text: I gave it a 5 because Roast Beef is so correct that the word "correct" cannot convey how completely correct this cat is.

name: roccolieuallen
text: Uncanny. I had this same conversation with my wife.

name: jonmw
text: Like silver cutlery, the reusable-skin fart will also turn black if you use it to eat eggs.

name: saulbellow
text:
Love and marriage
Love and marriage
They go together like
Silver cutlery and egg [soft double-g]
THAT'S just how we do
It could happen to yoooooouuuuuuuuu

name: ketelcat
text: "greasy queen" cracks me up every time =)
